description: To multiply two exponents with the same base, add their powers.
eli5: When the bases are the same, just add their exponents.

description: To divide two exponents with the same base, subtract the power of the denominator from the power of the numerator.
eli5: If you're dividing numbers with the same base, just subtract the bottom exponent from the top one.

description: To raise an exponent to another power, multiply the powers.
eli5: If you have a power raised to another power, multiply the exponents.

description: To raise a product to a power, raise each factor to the power.
eli5: When you raise two numbers multiplied together to a power, you can raise each number to that power separately.

description: To raise a quotient to a power, raise both the numerator and the denominator to the power.
eli5: When you raise a fraction to a power, you raise both the top and bottom numbers to that power.

description: Any base raised to the power of zero is one.
eli5: Anything raised to zero equals one.

description: Any base raised to a negative exponent is equal to the reciprocal of the base raised to the absolute value of the exponent.
eli5: A negative exponent means you take the reciprocal of the base and then raise it to the power of the exponent's positive value.
